title: [K-12] Exploring Power Dynamics in Collaborative Project-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social science knowledge and team project experience
context.additional_context: Project-based learning linked to social studies conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Students can analyze how power dynamics within teams influence collaborative learning opportunities
Students can identify question types (e.g., information request/authority confirmation/challenge) and explain their underlying intentions
Learners can recognize and adjust implicit power dynamics that arise during team role distribution.
Students can create portfolios that evaluate team dynamics by integrating digital tools (smartphone apps) with offline activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
